4.text: and said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of adultery.

5.text: In the law Moses commanded us to stone to death such women. What then do you say?”

6.text: (Now they were asking this in an attempt to trap him, so that they could bring charges against him.) Jesus bent down and wrote on the ground with his finger.

7.text: When they persisted in asking him, he stood up straight and replied, “Whoever among you is guiltless may be the first to throw a stone at her.”

8.text: Then he bent over again and wrote on the ground.

9.text: Now when they heard this, they began to drift away one at a time, starting with the older ones, until Jesus was left alone with the woman standing before him.

10.text: Jesus stood up straight and said to her, “Woman, where are they? Did no one condemn you?”

11.text: She replied, “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said, “I do not condemn you either. Go, and from now on do not sin any more.”]]

12.text: Then Jesus spoke out again, “I am the light of the world. The one who follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”

13.text: So the Pharisees objected, “You testify about yourself; your testimony is not true!”

14.text: Jesus answered, “Even if I testify about myself, my testimony is true, because I know where I came from and where I am going. But you people do not know where I came from or where I am going.

15.text: You people judge by outward appearances; I do not judge anyone.

16.text: But if I judge, my evaluation is accurate, because I am not alone when I judge, but I and the Father who sent me do so together.

17.text: It is written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.

18.text: I testify about myself and the Father who sent me testifies about me.”

19.text: Then they began asking him, “Who is your father?” Jesus answered, “You do not know either me or my Father. If you knew me you would know my Father too.”

20.text: (Jesus spoke these words near the offering box while he was teaching in the temple courts. No one seized him because his time had not yet come.)

21.text: Then Jesus said to them again, “I am going away, and you will look for me but will die in your sin. Where I am going you cannot come.”

22.text: So the Jewish leaders began to say, “Perhaps he is going to kill himself, because he says, ‘Where I am going you cannot come.’”

23.text: Jesus replied, “You people are from below; I am from above. You people are from this world; I am not from this world.

24.text: Thus I told you that you will die in your sins. For unless you believe that I am he, you will die in your sins.”

25.text: So they said to him, “Who are you?” Jesus replied, “What I have told you from the beginning.

26.text: I have many things to say and to judge about you, but the Father who sent me is truthful, and the things I have heard from him I speak to the world.”

27.text: (They did not understand that he was telling them about his Father.)

28.text: Then Jesus said, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and I do nothing on my own initiative, but I speak just what the Father taught me.

29.text: And the one who sent me is with me. He has not left me alone, because I always do those things that please him.”

30.text: While he was saying these things, many people believed in him.

31.text: Then Jesus said to those Judeans who had believed him, “If you continue to follow my teaching, you are really my disciples

32.text: and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”

33.text: “We are descendants of Abraham,” they replied, “and have never been anyone’s slaves! How can you say, ‘You will become free’?”

34.text: Jesus answered them, “I tell you the solemn truth, everyone who practices sin is a slave of sin.

35.text: The slave does not remain in the family forever, but the son remains forever.

36.text: So if the son sets you free, you will be really free.

37.text: I know that you are Abraham’s descendants. But you want to kill me, because my teaching makes no progress among you.

38.text: I am telling you the things I have seen while with the Father; as for you, practice the things you have heard from the Father!”

39.text: They answered him, “Abraham is our father!” Jesus replied, “If you are Abraham’s children, you would be doing the deeds of Abraham.

40.text: But now you are trying to kill me, a man who has told you the truth I heard from God. Abraham did not do this!

41.text: You people are doing the deeds of your father.” Then they said to Jesus, “We were not born as a result of immorality! We have only one Father, God himself.”

42.text: Jesus replied, “If God were your Father, you would love me, for I have come from God and am now here. I have not come on my own initiative, but he sent me.

43.text: Why don’t you understand what I am saying? It is because you cannot accept my teaching.

44.text: You people are from your father the devil, and you want to do what your father desires. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not uphold the truth, because there is no truth in him. Whenever he lies, he speaks according to his own nature, because he is a liar and the father of lies.

45.text: But because I am telling you the truth, you do not believe me.

46.text: Who among you can prove me guilty of any sin? If I am telling you the truth, why don’t you believe me?

47.text: The one who belongs to God listens and responds to God’s words. You don’t listen and respond, because you don’t belong to God.”

48.text: The Judeans replied, “Aren’t we correct in saying that you are a Samaritan and are possessed by a demon?”

49.text: Jesus answered, “I am not possessed by a demon, but I honor my Father – and yet you dishonor me.

50.text: I am not trying to get praise for myself. There is one who demands it, and he also judges.

51.text: I tell you the solemn truth, if anyone obeys my teaching, he will never see death.”

52.text: Then the Judeans responded, “Now we know you’re possessed by a demon! Both Abraham and the prophets died, and yet you say, ‘If anyone obeys my teaching, he will never experience death.’

53.text: You aren’t greater than our father Abraham who died, are you? And the prophets died too! Who do you claim to be?”

54.text: Jesus replied, “If I glorify myself, my glory is worthless. The one who glorifies me is my Father, about whom you people say, ‘He is our God.’

55.text: Yet you do not know him, but I know him. If I were to say that I do not know him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know him, and I obey his teaching.

56.text: Your father Abraham was overjoyed to see my day, and he saw it and was glad.”

57.text: Then the Judeans replied, “You are not yet fifty years old! Have you seen Abraham?”

58.text: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the solemn truth, before Abraham came into existence, I am!”

59.text: Then they picked up stones to throw at him, but Jesus hid himself and went out from the temple area.

1.text: “I tell you the solemn truth, the one who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs in some other way, is a thief and a robber.

2.text: The one who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.text: The doorkeeper opens the door for him, and the sheep hear his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

4.text: When he has brought all his own sheep out, he goes ahead of them, and the sheep follow him because they recognize his voice.

5.text: They will never follow a stranger, but will run away from him, because they do not recognize the stranger’s voice.”

6.text: Jesus told them this parable, but they did not understand what he was saying to them.

7.text: So Jesus said to them again, “I tell you the solemn truth, I am the door for the sheep.

8.text: All who came before me were thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.

9.text: I am the door. If anyone enters through me, he will be saved, and will come in and go out, and find pasture.

10.text: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come so that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.

11.text: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

12.text: The hired hand, who is not a shepherd and does not own sheep, sees the wolf coming and abandons the sheep and runs away. So the wolf attacks the sheep and scatters them.

13.text: Because he is a hired hand and is not concerned about the sheep, he runs away.

14.text: “I am the good shepherd. I know my own and my own know me –

15.text: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father – and I lay down my life for the sheep.

16.text: I have other sheep that do not come from this sheepfold. I must bring them too, and they will listen to my voice, so that there will be one flock and one shepherd.

17.text: This is why the Father loves me – because I lay down my life, so that I may take it back again.

18.text: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down of my own free will. I have the authority to lay it down, and I have the authority to take it back again. This commandment I received from my Father.”

19.text: Another sharp division took place among the Jewish people because of these words.

20.text: Many of them were saying, “He is possessed by a demon and has lost his mind! Why do you listen to him?”

21.text: Others said, “These are not the words of someone possessed by a demon. A demon cannot cause the blind to see, can it?”

22.text: Then came the feast of the Dedication in Jerusalem.

23.text: It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple area in Solomon’s Portico.

24.text: The Jewish leaders surrounded him and asked, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

25.text: Jesus replied, “I told you and you do not believe. The deeds I do in my Father’s name testify about me.

26.text: But you refuse to believe because you are not my sheep.

27.text: My sheep listen to my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

28.text: I give them eternal life, and they will never perish; no one will snatch them from my hand.

29.text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all, and no one can snatch them from my Father’s hand.

30.text: The Father and I are one.”

31.text: The Jewish leaders picked up rocks again to stone him to death.

32.text: Jesus said to them, “I have shown you many good deeds from the Father. For which one of them are you going to stone me?”

33.text: The Jewish leaders replied, “We are not going to stone you for a good deed but for blasphemy, because you, a man, are claiming to be God.”

34.text: Jesus answered, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods’?

35.text: If those people to whom the word of God came were called ‘gods’ (and the scripture cannot be broken),

36.text: do you say about the one whom the Father set apart and sent into the world, ‘You are blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?

37.text: If I do not perform the deeds of my Father, do not believe me.

38.text: But if I do them, even if you do not believe me, believe the deeds, so that you may come to know and understand that I am in the Father and the Father is in me.”

39.text: Then they attempted again to seize him, but he escaped their clutches.

40.text: Jesus went back across the Jordan River again to the place where John had been baptizing at an earlier time, and he stayed there.

41.text: Many came to him and began to say, “John performed no miraculous sign, but everything John said about this man was true!”

42.text: And many believed in Jesus there.

1.text: “Do not let your hearts be distressed. You believe in God; believe also in me.

2.text: There are many dwelling places in my Father’s house. Otherwise, I would have told you, because I am going away to make ready a place for you.

3.text: And if I go and make ready a place for you, I will come again and take you to be with me, so that where I am you may be too.

4.text: And you know the way where I am going.”

5.text: Thomas said, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. How can we know the way?”

6.text: Jesus replied, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

7.text: If you have known me, you will know my Father too. And from now on you do know him and have seen him.”

8.text: Philip said, “Lord, show us the Father, and we will be content.”

9.text: Jesus replied, “Have I been with you for so long, and you have not known me, Philip? The person who has seen me has seen the Father! How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?

10.text: Do you not believe that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you, I do not speak on my own initiative, but the Father residing in me performs his miraculous deeds.

11.text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me, but if you do not believe me, believe because of the miraculous deeds themselves.

12.text: I tell you the solemn truth, the person who believes in me will perform the miraculous deeds that I am doing, and will perform greater deeds than these, because I am going to the Father.

13.text: And I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

14.text: If you ask me anything in my name, I will do it.

15.text: “If you love me, you will obey my commandments.

16.text: Then I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Advocate to be with you forever –

17.text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot accept, because it does not see him or know him. But you know him, because he resides with you and will be in you.

18.text: “I will not abandon you as orphans, I will come to you.

19.text: In a little while the world will not see me any longer, but you will see me; because I live, you will live too.

20.text: You will know at that time that I am in my Father and you are in me and I am in you.

21.text: The person who has my commandments and obeys them is the one who loves me. The one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will reveal myself to him.”

22.text: “Lord,” Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, “what has happened that you are going to reveal yourself to us and not to the world?”

23.text: Jesus replied, “If anyone loves me, he will obey my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and take up residence with him.

24.text: The person who does not love me does not obey my words. And the word you hear is not mine, but the Father’s who sent me.

25.text: “I have spoken these things while staying with you.

26.text: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you everything, and will cause you to remember everything I said to you.

27.text: “Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you; I do not give it to you as the world does. Do not let your hearts be distressed or lacking in courage.

28.text: You heard me say to you, ‘I am going away and I am coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I am.

29.text: I have told you now before it happens, so that when it happens you may believe.

30.text: I will not speak with you much longer, for the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over me,

31.text: but I am doing just what the Father commanded me, so that the world may know that I love the Father. Get up, let us go from here.”

1.text: “I have told you all these things so that you will not fall away.

2.text: They will put you out of the synagogue, yet a time is coming when the one who kills you will think he is offering service to God.

3.text: They will do these things because they have not known the Father or me.

4.text: But I have told you these things so that when their time comes, you will remember that I told you about them. “I did not tell you these things from the beginning because I was with you.

5.text: But now I am going to the one who sent me, and not one of you is asking me, ‘Where are you going?’

6.text: Instead your hearts are filled with sadness because I have said these things to you.

7.text: But I tell you the truth, it is to your advantage that I am going away. For if I do not go away, the Advocate will not come to you, but if I go, I will send him to you.

8.text: And when he comes, he will prove the world wrong concerning sin and righteousness and judgment –

9.text: concerning sin, because they do not believe in me;

10.text: concerning righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you will see me no longer;

11.text: and concerning judgment, because the ruler of this world has been condemned.

12.text: “I have many more things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now.

13.text: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all truth. For he will not speak on his own authority, but will speak whatever he hears, and will tell you what is to come.

14.text: He will glorify me, because he will receive from me what is mine and will tell it to you.

15.text: Everything that the Father has is mine; that is why I said the Spirit will receive from me what is mine and will tell it to you.

16.text: In a little while you will see me no longer; again after a little while, you will see me.”

17.text: Then some of his disciples said to one another, “What is the meaning of what he is saying, ‘In a little while you will not see me; again after a little while, you will see me,’ and, ‘because I am going to the Father’?”

18.text: So they kept on repeating, “What is the meaning of what he says, ‘In a little while’? We do not understand what he is talking about.”

19.text: Jesus could see that they wanted to ask him about these things, so he said to them, “Are you asking each other about this – that I said, ‘In a little while you will not see me; again after a little while, you will see me’?

20.text: I tell you the solemn truth, you will weep and wail, but the world will rejoice; you will be sad, but your sadness will turn into joy.

21.text: When a woman gives birth, she has distress because her time has come, but when her child is born, she no longer remembers the suffering because of her joy that a human being has been born into the world.

22.text: So also you have sorrow now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.

23.text: At that time you will ask me nothing. I tell you the solemn truth, whatever you ask the Father in my name he will give you.

24.text: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive it, so that your joy may be complete.

25.text: “I have told you these things in obscure figures of speech; a time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in obscure figures, but will tell you plainly about the Father.

26.text: At that time you will ask in my name, and I do not say that I will ask the Father on your behalf.

27.text: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.

28.text: I came from the Father and entered into the world, but in turn, I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.”

29.text: His disciples said, “Look, now you are speaking plainly and not in obscure figures of speech!

30.text: Now we know that you know everything and do not need anyone to ask you anything. Because of this we believe that you have come from God.”

31.text: Jesus replied, “Do you now believe?

32.text: Look, a time is coming – and has come – when you will be scattered, each one to his own home, and I will be left alone. Yet I am not alone, because my Father is with me.

33.text: I have told you these things so that in me you may have peace. In the world you have trouble and suffering, but take courage – I have conquered the world.”

1.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he looked upward to heaven and said, “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, so that your Son may glorify you –

2.text: just as you have given him authority over all humanity, so that he may give eternal life to everyone you have given him.

3.text: Now this is eternal life – that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you sent.

4.text: I glorified you on earth by completing the work you gave me to do.

5.text: And now, Father, glorify me at your side with the glory I had with you before the world was created.

6.text: “I have revealed your name to the men you gave me out of the world. They belonged to you, and you gave them to me, and they have obeyed your word.

7.text: Now they understand that everything you have given me comes from you,

8.text: because I have given them the words you have given me. They accepted them and really understand that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.

9.text: I am praying on behalf of them. I am not praying on behalf of the world, but on behalf of those you have given me, because they belong to you.

10.text: Everything I have belongs to you, and everything you have belongs to me, and I have been glorified by them.

11.text: I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them safe in your name that you have given me, so that they may be one just as we are one.

12.text: When I was with them I kept them safe and watched over them in your name that you have given me. Not one of them was lost except the one destined for destruction, so that the scripture could be fulfilled.

13.text: But now I am coming to you, and I am saying these things in the world, so they may experience my joy completed in themselves.

14.text: I have given them your word, and the world has hated them, because they do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.

15.text: I am not asking you to take them out of the world, but that you keep them safe from the evil one.

16.text: They do not belong to the world just as I do not belong to the world.

17.text: Set them apart in the truth; your word is truth.

18.text: Just as you sent me into the world, so I sent them into the world.

19.text: And I set myself apart on their behalf, so that they too may be truly set apart.

20.text: “I am not praying only on their behalf, but also on behalf of those who believe in me through their testimony,

21.text: that they will all be one, just as you, Father, are in me and I am in you. I pray that they will be in us, so that the world will believe that you sent me.

22.text: The glory you gave to me I have given to them, that they may be one just as we are one –

23.text: I in them and you in me – that they may be completely one, so that the world will know that you sent me, and you have loved them just as you have loved me.

24.text: “Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, so that they can see my glory that you gave me because you loved me before the creation of the world .

25.text: Righteous Father, even if the world does not know you, I know you, and these men know that you sent me.

26.text: I made known your name to them, and I will continue to make it known, so that the love you have loved me with may be in them, and I may be in them.”

1.text: Now very early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb and saw that the stone had been moved away from the entrance.

2.text: So she went running to Simon Peter and the other disciple whom Jesus loved and told them, “They have taken the Lord from the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!”

3.text: Then Peter and the other disciple set out to go to the tomb.

4.text: The two were running together, but the other disciple ran faster than Peter and reached the tomb first.

5.text: He bent down and saw the strips of linen cloth lying there, but he did not go in.

6.text: Then Simon Peter, who had been following him, arrived and went right into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen cloth lying there,

7.text: and the face cloth, which had been around Jesus’ head, not lying with the strips of linen cloth but rolled up in a place by itself.

8.text: Then the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, came in, and he saw and believed.

9.text: (For they did not yet understand the scripture that Jesus must rise from the dead.)

10.text: So the disciples went back to their homes.

11.text: But Mary stood outside the tomb weeping. As she wept, she bent down and looked into the tomb.

12.text: And she saw two angels in white sitting where Jesus’ body had been lying, one at the head and one at the feet.

13.text: They said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” Mary replied, “They have taken my Lord away, and I do not know where they have put him!”

14.text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that it was Jesus.

15.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” Because she thought he was the gardener, she said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will take him.”

16.text: Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned and said to him in Aramaic, “Rabboni” (which means Teacher).

17.text: Jesus replied, “Do not touch me, for I have not yet ascended to my Father. Go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”

18.text: Mary Magdalene came and informed the disciples, “I have seen the Lord!” And she told them what Jesus had said to her.

19.text: On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, the disciples had gathered together and locked the doors of the place because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders. Jesus came and stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.”

20.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.

21.text: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. Just as the Father has sent me, I also send you.”

22.text: And after he said this, he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.

23.text: If you forgive anyone’s sins, they are forgiven; if you retain anyone’s sins, they are retained.”

24.text: Now Thomas (called Didymus), one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.

25.text: The other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he replied, “Unless I see the wounds from the nails in his hands, and put my finger into the wounds from the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will never believe it!”

26.text: Eight days later the disciples were again together in the house, and Thomas was with them. Although the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you!”

27.text: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and examine my hands. Extend your hand and put it into my side. Do not continue in your unbelief, but believe.”

28.text: Thomas replied to him, “My Lord and my God!”

29.text: Jesus said to him, “Have you believed because you have seen me? Blessed are the people who have not seen and yet have believed.”

30.text: Now Jesus performed many other miraculous signs in the presence of the disciples, which are not recorded in this book.

31.text: But these are recorded so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.

1.text: When I came to you, brothers and sisters, I did not come with superior eloquence or wisdom as I proclaimed the testimony of God.

2.text: For I decided to be concerned about nothing among you except Jesus Christ, and him crucified.

3.text: And I was with you in weakness and in fear and with much trembling.

4.text: My conversation and my preaching were not with persuasive words of wisdom, but with a demonstration of the Spirit and of power,

5.text: so that your faith would not be based on human wisdom but on the power of God.

6.text: Now we do speak wisdom among the mature, but not a wisdom of this age or of the rulers of this age, who are perishing.

7.text: Instead we speak the wisdom of God, hidden in a mystery, that God determined before the ages for our glory.

8.text: None of the rulers of this age understood it. If they had known it, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

9.text: But just as it is written, “Things that no eye has seen, or ear heard, or mind imagined, are the things God has prepared for those who love him.”

10.text: God has revealed these to us by the Spirit. For the Spirit searches all things, even the deep things of God.

11.text: For who among men knows the things of a man except the man’s spirit within him? So too, no one knows the things of God except the Spirit of God.

12.text: Now we have not received the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, so that we may know the things that are freely given to us by God.

13.text: And we speak about these things, not with words taught us by human wisdom, but with those taught by the Spirit, explaining spiritual things to spiritual people.

14.text: The unbeliever does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him. And he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned.

15.text: The one who is spiritual discerns all things, yet he himself is understood by no one.

16.text: For who has known the mind of the Lord, so as to advise him? But we have the mind of Christ.

1.text: So, brothers and sisters, I could not speak to you as spiritual people, but instead as people of the flesh, as infants in Christ.

2.text: I fed you milk, not solid food, for you were not yet ready. In fact, you are still not ready,

3.text: for you are still influenced by the flesh. For since there is still jealousy and dissension among you, are you not influenced by the flesh and behaving like unregenerate people?

4.text: For whenever someone says, “I am with Paul,” or “I am with Apollos,” are you not merely human?

5.text: What is Apollos, really? Or what is Paul? Servants through whom you came to believe, and each of us in the ministry the Lord gave us.

6.text: I planted, Apollos watered, but God caused it to grow.

7.text: So neither the one who plants counts for anything, nor the one who waters, but God who causes the growth.

8.text: The one who plants and the one who waters work as one, but each will receive his reward according to his work.

9.text: We are coworkers belonging to God. You are God’s field, God’s building.

10.text: According to the grace of God given to me, like a skilled master-builder I laid a foundation, but someone else builds on it. And each one must be careful how he builds.

11.text: For no one can lay any foundation other than what is being laid, which is Jesus Christ.

12.text: If anyone builds on the foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, or straw,

13.text: each builder’s work will be plainly seen, for the Day will make it clear, because it will be revealed by fire. And the fire will test what kind of work each has done.

14.text: If what someone has built survives, he will receive a reward.

15.text: If someone’s work is burned up, he will suffer loss. He himself will be saved, but only as through fire.

16.text: Do you not know that you are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit lives in you?

17.text: If someone destroys God’s temple, God will destroy him. For God’s temple is holy, which is what you are.

18.text: Guard against self-deception, each of you. If someone among you thinks he is wise in this age, let him become foolish so that he can become wise.

19.text: For the wisdom of this age is foolishness with God. As it is written, “He catches the wise in their craftiness.”

20.text: And again, “The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are futile.”

21.text: So then, no more boasting about mere mortals! For everything belongs to you,

22.text: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or the present or the future. Everything belongs to you,

23.text: and you belong to Christ, and Christ belongs to God.

1.text: Now I want to make clear for you, brothers and sisters, the gospel that I preached to you, that you received and on which you stand,

2.text: and by which you are being saved, if you hold firmly to the message I preached to you – unless you believed in vain.

3.text: For I passed on to you as of first importance what I also received – that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures,

4.text: and that he was buried, and that he was raised on the third day according to the scriptures,

5.text: and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.

6.text: Then he appeared to more than five hundred of the brothers and sisters at one time, most of whom are still alive, though some have fallen asleep.

7.text: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles.

8.text: Last of all, as though to one born at the wrong time, he appeared to me also.

9.text: For I am the least of the apostles, unworthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

10.text: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace to me has not been in vain. In fact, I worked harder than all of them – yet not I, but the grace of God with me.

11.text: Whether then it was I or they, this is the way we preach and this is the way you believed.

12.text: Now if Christ is being preached as raised from the dead, how can some of you say there is no resurrection of the dead?

13.text: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, then not even Christ has been raised.

14.text: And if Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is futile and your faith is empty.

15.text: Also, we are found to be false witnesses about God, because we have testified against God that he raised Christ from the dead, when in reality he did not raise him, if indeed the dead are not raised.

16.text: For if the dead are not raised, then not even Christ has been raised.

17.text: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is useless; you are still in your sins.

18.text: Furthermore, those who have fallen asleep in Christ have also perished.

19.text: For if only in this life we have hope in Christ, we should be pitied more than anyone.

20.text: But now Christ has been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.

21.text: For since death came through a man, the resurrection of the dead also came through a man.

22.text: For just as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all will be made alive.

23.text: But each in his own order: Christ, the firstfruits; then when Christ comes, those who belong to him.

24.text: Then comes the end, when he hands over the kingdom to God the Father, when he has brought to an end all rule and all authority and power.

25.text: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.

26.text: The last enemy to be eliminated is death.

27.text: For he has put everything in subjection under his feet everything in subjection under his feet. But when it says “everything” has been put in subjection, it is clear that this does not include the one who put everything in subjection to him.

28.text: And when all things are subjected to him, then the Son himself will be subjected to the one who subjected everything to him, so that God may be all in all.

29.text: Otherwise, what will those do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, then why are they baptized for them?

30.text: Why too are we in danger every hour?

31.text: Every day I am in danger of death! This is as sure as my boasting in you, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.

32.text: If from a human point of view I fought with wild beasts at Ephesus, what did it benefit me? If the dead are not raised, let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.

33.text: Do not be deceived: “Bad company corrupts good morals.”

34.text: Sober up as you should, and stop sinning! For some have no knowledge of God – I say this to your shame!

35.text: But someone will say, “How are the dead raised? With what kind of body will they come?”

36.text: Fool! What you sow will not come to life unless it dies.

37.text: And what you sow is not the body that is to be, but a bare seed – perhaps of wheat or something else.

38.text: But God gives it a body just as he planned, and to each of the seeds a body of its own.

39.text: All flesh is not the same: People have one flesh, animals have another, birds and fish another.

40.text: And there are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies. The glory of the heavenly body is one sort and the earthly another.

41.text: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon and another glory of the stars, for star differs from star in glory.

42.text: It is the same with the resurrection of the dead. What is sown is perishable, what is raised is imperishable.

43.text: It is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;

44.text: it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

45.text: So also it is written, “The first man, Adam, became a living person”; the last Adam became a life-giving spirit.

46.text: However, the spiritual did not come first, but the natural, and then the spiritual.

47.text: The first man is from the earth, made of dust; the second man is from heaven.

48.text: Like the one made of dust, so too are those made of dust, and like the one from heaven, so too those who are heavenly.

49.text: And just as we have borne the image of the man of dust, let us also bear the image of the man of heaven.

50.text: Now this is what I am saying, brothers and sisters: Flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.

51.text: Listen, I will tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed –

52.text: in a moment, in the blinking of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.

53.text: For this perishable body must put on the imperishable, and this mortal body must put on immortality.

54.text: Now when this perishable puts on the imperishable, and this mortal puts on immortality, then the saying that is written will happen, “Death has been swallowed up in victory.”

55.text: “Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?”

56.text: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.

57.text: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ!

58.text: So then, dear brothers and sisters, be firm. Do not be moved! Always be outstanding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.

1.text: Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? We don’t need letters of recommendation to you or from you as some other people do, do we?

2.text: You yourselves are our letter, written on our hearts, known and read by everyone,

3.text: revealing that you are a letter of Christ, delivered by us, written not with ink but by the Spirit of the living God, not on stone tablets but on tablets of human hearts.

4.text: Now we have such confidence in God through Christ.

5.text: Not that we are adequate in ourselves to consider anything as if it were coming from ourselves, but our adequacy is from God,

6.text: who made us adequate to be servants of a new covenant not based on the letter but on the Spirit, for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

7.text: But if the ministry that produced death – carved in letters on stone tablets – came with glory, so that the Israelites could not keep their eyes fixed on the face of Moses because of the glory of his face (a glory which was made ineffective),

8.text: how much more glorious will the ministry of the Spirit be?

9.text: For if there was glory in the ministry that produced condemnation, how much more does the ministry that produces righteousness excel in glory!

10.text: For indeed, what had been glorious now has no glory because of the tremendously greater glory of what replaced it.

11.text: For if what was made ineffective came with glory, how much more has what remains come in glory!

12.text: Therefore, since we have such a hope, we behave with great boldness,

13.text: and not like Moses who used to put a veil over his face to keep the Israelites from staring at the result of the glory that was made ineffective.

14.text: But their minds were closed. For to this very day, the same veil remains when they hear the old covenant read. It has not been removed because only in Christ is it taken away.

15.text: But until this very day whenever Moses is read, a veil lies over their minds,

16.text: but when one turns to the Lord, the veil is removed.

17.text: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is present, there is freedom.

18.text: And we all, with unveiled faces reflecting the glory of the Lord, are being transformed into the same image from one degree of glory to another, which is from the Lord, who is the Spirit.

1.text: For we know that if our earthly house, the tent we live in, is dismantled, we have a building from God, a house not built by human hands, that is eternal in the heavens.

2.text: For in this earthly house we groan, because we desire to put on our heavenly dwelling,

3.text: if indeed, after we have put on our heavenly house, we will not be found naked.

4.text: For we groan while we are in this tent, since we are weighed down, because we do not want to be unclothed, but clothed, so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.

5.text: Now the one who prepared us for this very purpose is God, who gave us the Spirit as a down payment.

6.text: Therefore we are always full of courage, and we know that as long as we are alive here on earth we are absent from the Lord –

7.text: for we live by faith, not by sight.

8.text: Thus we are full of courage and would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord.

9.text: So then whether we are alive or away, we make it our ambition to please him.

10.text: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, so that each one may be paid back according to what he has done while in the body, whether good or evil.

11.text: Therefore, because we know the fear of the Lord, we try to persuade people, but we are well known to God, and I hope we are well known to your consciences too.

12.text: We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again, but are giving you an opportunity to be proud of us, so that you may be able to answer those who take pride in outward appearance and not in what is in the heart.

13.text: For if we are out of our minds, it is for God; if we are of sound mind, it is for you.

14.text: For the love of Christ controls us, since we have concluded this, that Christ died for all; therefore all have died.

15.text: And he died for all so that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for him who died for them and was raised.

16.text: So then from now on we acknowledge no one from an outward human point of view. Even though we have known Christ from such a human point of view, now we do not know him in that way any longer.

17.text: So then, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; what is old has passed away – look, what is new has come!

18.text: And all these things are from God who reconciled us to himself through Christ, and who has given us the ministry of reconciliation.

19.text: In other words, in Christ God was reconciling the world to himself, not counting people’s trespasses against them, and he has given us the message of reconciliation.

20.text: Therefore we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were making His plea through us. We plead with you on Christ’s behalf, “Be reconciled to God!”

21.text: God made the one who did not know sin to be sin for us, so that in him we would become the righteousness of God.

1.text: It is necessary to go on boasting. Though it is not profitable, I will go on to visions and revelations from the Lord.

2.text: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago (whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows) was caught up to the third heaven.

3.text: And I know that this man (whether in the body or apart from the body I do not know, God knows)

4.text: was caught up into paradise and heard things too sacred to be put into words, things that a person is not permitted to speak.

5.text: On behalf of such an individual I will boast, but on my own behalf I will not boast, except about my weaknesses.

6.text: For even if I wish to boast, I will not be a fool, for I would be telling the truth, but I refrain from this so that no one may regard me beyond what he sees in me or what he hears from me,

7.text: even because of the extraordinary character of the revelations. Therefore, so that I would not become arrogant, a thorn in the flesh was given to me, a messenger of Satan to trouble me – so that I would not become arrogant.

8.text: I asked the Lord three times about this, that it would depart from me.

9.text: But he said to me, “My grace is enough for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.” So then, I will boast most gladly about my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may reside in me.

10.text: Therefore I am content with weaknesses, with insults, with troubles, with persecutions and difficulties for the sake of Christ, for whenever I am weak, then I am strong.

11.text: I have become a fool. You yourselves forced me to do it, for I should have been commended by you. For I lack nothing in comparison to those “super-apostles,” even though I am nothing.

12.text: Indeed, the signs of an apostle were performed among you with great perseverance by signs and wonders and powerful deeds.

13.text: For how were you treated worse than the other churches, except that I myself was not a burden to you? Forgive me this injustice!

14.text: Look, for the third time I am ready to come to you, and I will not be a burden to you, because I do not want your possessions, but you. For children should not have to save up for their parents, but parents for their children.

15.text: Now I will most gladly spend and be spent for your lives! If I love you more, am I to be loved less?

16.text: But be that as it may, I have not burdened you. Yet because I was a crafty person, I took you in by deceit!

17.text: I have not taken advantage of you through anyone I have sent to you, have I?

18.text: I urged Titus to visit you and I sent our brother along with him. Titus did not take advantage of you, did he? Did we not conduct ourselves in the same spirit? Did we not behave in the same way?

19.text: Have you been thinking all this time that we have been defending ourselves to you? We are speaking in Christ before God, and everything we do, dear friends, is to build you up.

20.text: For I am afraid that somehow when I come I will not find you what I wish, and you will find me not what you wish. I am afraid that somehow there may be quarreling, jealousy, intense anger, selfish ambition, slander, gossip, arrogance, and disorder.

21.text: I am afraid that when I come again, my God may humiliate me before you, and I will grieve for many of those who previously sinned and have not repented of the impurity, sexual immorality, and licentiousness that they have practiced.

1.text: This is the third time I am coming to visit you. By the testimony the testimony of two or three witnesses every matter will be established.

2.text: I said before when I was present the second time and now, though absent, I say again to those who sinned previously and to all the rest, that if I come again, I will not spare anyone,

3.text: since you are demanding proof that Christ is speaking through me. He is not weak toward you but is powerful among you.

4.text: For indeed he was crucified by reason of weakness, but he lives because of God’s power. For we also are weak in him, but we will live together with him, because of God’s power toward you.

5.text: Put yourselves to the test to see if you are in the faith; examine yourselves! Or do you not recognize regarding yourselves that Jesus Christ is in you – unless, indeed, you fail the test!

6.text: And I hope that you will realize that we have not failed the test!

7.text: Now we pray to God that you may not do anything wrong, not so that we may appear to have passed the test, but so that you may do what is right even if we may appear to have failed the test.

8.text: For we cannot do anything against the truth, but only for the sake of the truth.

9.text: For we rejoice whenever we are weak, but you are strong. And we pray for this: that you may become fully qualified.

10.text: Because of this I am writing these things while absent, so that when I arrive I may not have to deal harshly with you by using my authority – the Lord gave it to me for building up, not for tearing down!

11.text: Finally, brothers and sisters, rejoice, set things right, be encouraged, agree with one another, live in peace, and the God of love and peace will be with you.

12.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the saints greet you.

13.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of God and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.

1.text: From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, to further the promise of life in Christ Jesus,

2.text: to Timothy, my dear child. Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord!

3.text: I am thankful to God, whom I have served with a clear conscience as my ancestors did, when I remember you in my prayers as I do constantly night and day.

4.text: As I remember your tears, I long to see you, so that I may be filled with joy.

5.text: I recall your sincere faith that was alive first in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice, and I am sure is in you.

6.text: Because of this I remind you to rekindle God’s gift that you possess through the laying on of my hands.

7.text: For God did not give us a Spirit of fear but of power and love and self-control.

8.text: So do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord or of me, a prisoner for his sake, but by God’s power accept your share of suffering for the gospel.

9.text: He is the one who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not based on our works but on his own purpose and grace, granted to us in Christ Jesus before time began,

10.text: but now made visible through the appearing of our Savior Christ Jesus. He has broken the power of death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel!

11.text: For this gospel I was appointed a preacher and apostle and teacher.

12.text: Because of this, in fact, I suffer as I do. But I am not ashamed, because I know the one in whom my faith is set and I am convinced that he is able to protect what has been entrusted to me until that day.

13.text: Hold to the standard of sound words that you heard from me and do so with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.

14.text: Protect that good thing entrusted to you, through the Holy Spirit who lives within us.

15.text: You know that everyone in the province of Asia deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.

16.text: May the Lord grant mercy to the family of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my imprisonment.

17.text: But when he arrived in Rome, he eagerly searched for me and found me.

18.text: May the Lord grant him to find mercy from the Lord on that day! And you know very well all the ways he served me in Ephesus.

1.text: So you, my child, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

2.text: And entrust what you heard me say in the presence of many others as witnesses to faithful people who will be competent to teach others as well.

3.text: Take your share of suffering as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

4.text: No one in military service gets entangled in matters of everyday life; otherwise he will not please the one who recruited him.

5.text: Also, if anyone competes as an athlete, he will not be crowned as the winner unless he competes according to the rules.

6.text: The farmer who works hard ought to have the first share of the crops.

7.text: Think about what I am saying and the Lord will give you understanding of all this.

8.text: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, a descendant of David; such is my gospel,

9.text: for which I suffer hardship to the point of imprisonment as a criminal, but God’s message is not imprisoned!

10.text: So I endure all things for the sake of those chosen by God, that they too may obtain salvation in Christ Jesus and its eternal glory.

11.text: This saying is trustworthy: If we died with him, we will also live with him.

12.text: If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he will also deny us.

13.text: If we are unfaithful, he remains faithful, since he cannot deny himself.

14.text: Remind people of these things and solemnly charge them before the Lord not to wrangle over words. This is of no benefit; it just brings ruin on those who listen.

15.text: Make every effort to present yourself before God as a proven worker who does not need to be ashamed, teaching the message of truth accurately.

16.text: But avoid profane chatter, because those occupied with it will stray further and further into ungodliness,

17.text: and their message will spread its infection like gangrene. Hymenaeus and Philetus are in this group.

18.text: They have strayed from the truth by saying that the resurrection has already occurred, and they are undermining some people’s faith.

19.text: However, God’s solid foundation remains standing, bearing this seal: “The Lord knows those who are his,” and “Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from evil.”

20.text: Now in a wealthy home there are not only gold and silver vessels, but also ones made of wood and of clay, and some are for honorable use, but others for ignoble use.

21.text: So if someone cleanses himself of such behavior, he will be a vessel for honorable use, set apart, useful for the Master, prepared for every good work.

22.text: But keep away from youthful passions, and pursue righteousness, faithfulness, love, and peace, in company with others who call on the Lord from a pure heart.

23.text: But reject foolish and ignorant controversies, because you know they breed infighting.

24.text: And the Lord’s slave must not engage in heated disputes but be kind toward all, an apt teacher, patient,

25.text: correcting opponents with gentleness. Perhaps God will grant them repentance and then knowledge of the truth

26.text: and they will come to their senses and escape the devil’s trap where they are held captive to do his will.

1.text: But understand this, that in the last days difficult times will come.

2.text: For people will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, unholy,

3.text: unloving, irreconcilable, slanderers, without self-control, savage, opposed to what is good,

4.text: treacherous, reckless, conceited, loving pleasure rather than loving God.

5.text: They will maintain the outward appearance of religion but will have repudiated its power. So avoid people like these.

6.text: For some of these insinuate themselves into households and captivate weak women who are overwhelmed with sins and led along by various passions.

7.text: Such women are always seeking instruction, yet never able to arrive at a knowledge of the truth.

8.text: And just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so these people – who have warped minds and are disqualified in the faith – also oppose the truth.

9.text: But they will not go much further, for their foolishness will be obvious to everyone, just like it was with Jannes and Jambres.

10.text: You, however, have followed my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, my faith, my patience, my love, my endurance,

11.text: as well as the persecutions and sufferings that happened to me in Antioch, I endured these persecutions and the Lord delivered me from them all.

12.text: Now in fact all who want to live godly lives in Christ Jesus will be persecuted.

13.text: But evil people and charlatans will go from bad to worse, deceiving others and being deceived themselves.

14.text: You, however, must continue in the things you have learned and are confident about. You know who taught you

15.text: and how from infancy you have known the holy writings, which are able to give you wisdom for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.

16.text: Every scripture is inspired by God and useful for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,

17.text: that the person dedicated to God may be capable and equipped for every good work.

1.text: Now these are the commandments, statutes, and ordinances that the Lord your God instructed me to teach you so that you may carry them out in the land where you are headed

2.text: and that you may so revere the Lord your God that you will keep all his statutes and commandments that I am giving you – you, your children, and your grandchildren – all your lives, to prolong your days.

3.text: Pay attention, Israel, and be careful to do this so that it may go well with you and that you may increase greatly in number – as the Lord, God of your ancestors, said to you, you will have a land flowing with milk and honey.

4.text: Listen, Israel: The Lord is our God, the Lord is one!

5.text: You must love the Lord your God with your whole mind, your whole being, and all your strength.

6.text: These words I am commanding you today must be kept in mind,

7.text: and you must teach them to your children and speak of them as you sit in your house, as you walk along the road, as you lie down, and as you get up.

8.text: You should tie them as a reminder on your forearm and fasten them as symbols on your forehead.

9.text: Inscribe them on the doorframes of your houses and gates.

10.text: Then when the Lord your God brings you to the land he promised your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob to give you – a land with large, fine cities you did not build,

11.text: houses filled with choice things you did not accumulate, hewn out cisterns you did not dig, and vineyards and olive groves you did not plant – and you eat your fill,

12.text: be careful not to forget the Lord who brought you out of Egypt, that place of slavery.

13.text: You must revere the Lord your God, serve him, and take oaths using only his name.

14.text: You must not go after other gods, those of the surrounding peoples,

15.text: for the Lord your God, who is present among you, is a jealous God and his anger will erupt against you and remove you from the land.

16.text: You must not put the Lord your God to the test as you did at Massah.

17.text: Keep his commandments very carefully, as well as the stipulations and statutes he commanded you to observe.

18.text: Do whatever is proper and good before the Lord so that it may go well with you and that you may enter and occupy the good land that he promised your ancestors,

19.text: and that you may drive out all your enemies just as the Lord said.

20.text: When your children ask you later on, “What are the stipulations, statutes, and ordinances that the Lord our God commanded you?”

21.text: you must say to them, “We were Pharaoh’s slaves in Egypt, but the Lord brought us out of Egypt in a powerful way.

22.text: And he brought signs and great, devastating wonders on Egypt, on Pharaoh, and on his whole family before our very eyes.

23.text: He delivered us from there so that he could give us the land he had promised our ancestors.

24.text: The Lord commanded us to obey all these statutes and to revere him so that it may always go well for us and he may preserve us, as he has to this day.

25.text: We will be innocent if we carefully keep all these commandments before the Lord our God, just as he demands.”

1.text: You must love the Lord your God and do what he requires; keep his statutes, ordinances, and commandments at all times.

2.text: Bear in mind today that I am not speaking to your children who have not personally experienced the judgments of the Lord your God, which revealed his greatness, strength, and power.

3.text: They did not see the awesome deeds he performed in the midst of Egypt against Pharaoh king of Egypt and his whole land,

4.text: or what he did to the army of Egypt, including their horses and chariots, when he made the waters of the Red Sea overwhelm them while they were pursuing you and he annihilated them.

5.text: They did not see what he did to you in the desert before you reached this place,

6.text: or what he did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab the Reubenite, when the earth opened its mouth in the middle of the Israelite camp and swallowed them, their families, their tents, and all the property they brought with them.

7.text: I am speaking to you because you are the ones who saw all the great deeds of the Lord!

8.text: Now pay attention to all the commandments I am giving you today, so that you may be strong enough to enter and possess the land where you are headed,

9.text: and that you may enjoy long life in the land the Lord promised to give to your ancestors and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.

10.text: For the land where you are headed is not like the land of Egypt from which you came, a land where you planted seed and which you irrigated by hand like a vegetable garden.

11.text: Instead, the land you are crossing the Jordan to occupy is one of hills and valleys, a land that drinks in water from the rains,

12.text: a land the Lord your God looks after. He is constantly attentive to it from the beginning to the end of the year.

13.text: Now, if you pay close attention to my commandments that I am giving you today and love the Lord your God and serve him with all your mind and being,

14.text: then he promises, “I will send rain for your land in its season, the autumn and the spring rains, so that you may gather in your grain, new wine, and olive oil.

15.text: I will provide pasture for your livestock and you will eat your fill.”

16.text: Make sure you do not turn away to serve and worship other gods!

17.text: Then the anger of the Lord will erupt against you and he will close up the sky so that it does not rain. The land will not yield its produce, and you will soon be removed from the good land that the Lord is about to give you.

18.text: Fix these words of mine into your mind and being, and tie them as a reminder on your hands and let them be symbols on your forehead.

19.text: Teach them to your children and speak of them as you sit in your house, as you walk along the road, as you lie down, and as you get up.

20.text: Inscribe them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates

21.text: so that your days and those of your descendants may be extended in the land which the Lord promised to give to your ancestors, like the days of heaven itself.

22.text: For if you carefully observe all of these commandments I am giving you and love the Lord your God, live according to his standards, and remain loyal to him,

23.text: then he will drive out all these nations ahead of you, and you will dispossess nations greater and stronger than you.

24.text: Every place you set your foot will be yours; your border will extend from the desert to Lebanon and from the River (that is, the Euphrates) as far as the Mediterranean Sea.

25.text: Nobody will be able to resist you; the Lord your God will spread the fear and terror of you over the whole land on which you walk, just as he promised you.

26.text: Take note – I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse:

27.text: the blessing if you take to heart the commandments of the Lord your God that I am giving you today,

28.text: and the curse if you pay no attention to his commandments and turn from the way I am setting before you today to pursue other gods you have not known.

29.text: When the Lord your God brings you into the land you are to possess, you must pronounce the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.

30.text: Are they not across the Jordan River, toward the west, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah opposite Gilgal near the oak of Moreh?

31.text: For you are about to cross the Jordan to possess the land the Lord your God is giving you, and you will possess and inhabit it.

32.text: Be certain to keep all the statutes and ordinances that I am presenting to you today.

1.text: This is what we proclaim to you: what was from the beginning, what we have heard, what we have seen with our eyes, what we have looked at and our hands have touched (concerning the word of life –

2.text: and the life was revealed, and we have seen and testify and announce to you the eternal life that was with the Father and was revealed to us).

3.text: What we have seen and heard we announce to you too, so that you may have fellowship with us (and indeed our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ).

4.text: Thus we are writing these things so that our joy may be complete.

5.text: Now this is the gospel message we have heard from him and announce to you: God is light, and in him there is no darkness at all.

6.text: If we say we have fellowship with him and yet keep on walking in the darkness, we are lying and not practicing the truth.

7.text: But if we walk in the light as he himself is in the light, we have fellowship with one another and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.

8.text: If we say we do not bear the guilt of sin, we are deceiving ourselves and the truth is not in us.

9.text: But if we confess our sins, he is faithful and righteous, forgiving us our sins and cleansing us from all unrighteousness.

10.text: If we say we have not sinned, we make him a liar and his word is not in us.

1.text: (My little children, I am writing these things to you so that you may not sin. ) But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous One,

2.text: and he himself is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not only for our sins but also for the whole world.

3.text: Now by this we know that we have come to know God: if we keep his commandments.

4.text: The one who says “I have come to know God” and yet does not keep his commandments is a liar, and the truth is not in such a person.

5.text: But whoever obeys his word, truly in this person the love of God has been perfected. By this we know that we are in him.

6.text: The one who says he resides in God ought himself to walk just as Jesus walked.

7.text: Dear friends, I am not writing a new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you have had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word that you have already heard.

8.text: On the other hand, I am writing a new commandment to you which is true in him and in you, because the darkness is passing away and the true light is already shining.

9.text: The one who says he is in the light but still hates his fellow Christian is still in the darkness.

10.text: The one who loves his fellow Christian resides in the light, and there is no cause for stumbling in him.

11.text: But the one who hates his fellow Christian is in the darkness, walks in the darkness, and does not know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded his eyes.

12.text: I am writing to you, little children, that your sins have been forgiven because of his name.

13.text: I am writing to you, fathers, that you have known him who has been from the beginning. I am writing to you, young people, that you have conquered the evil one.

14.text: I have written to you, children, that you have known the Father. I have written to you, fathers, that you have known him who has been from the beginning. I have written to you, young people, that you are strong, and the word of God resides in you, and you have conquered the evil one.

15.text: Do not love the world or the things in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him,

16.text: because all that is in the world (the desire of the flesh and the desire of the eyes and the arrogance produced by material possessions) is not from the Father, but is from the world.

17.text: And the world is passing away with all its desires, but the person who does the will of God remains forever.

18.text: Children, it is the last hour, and just as you heard that the antichrist is coming, so now many antichrists have appeared. We know from this that it is the last hour.

19.text: They went out from us, but they did not really belong to us, because if they had belonged to us, they would have remained with us. But they went out from us to demonstrate that all of them do not belong to us.

20.text: Nevertheless you have an anointing from the Holy One, and you all know.

21.text: I have not written to you that you do not know the truth, but that you do know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

22.text: Who is the liar but the person who denies that Jesus is the Christ ? This one is the antichrist: the person who denies the Father and the Son.

23.text: Everyone who denies the Son does not have the Father either. The person who confesses the Son has the Father also.

24.text: As for you, what you have heard from the beginning must remain in you. If what you heard from the beginning remains in you, you also will remain in the Son and in the Father.

25.text: Now this is the promise that he himself made to us: eternal life.

26.text: These things I have written to you about those who are trying to deceive you.

27.text: Now as for you, the anointing that you received from him resides in you, and you have no need for anyone to teach you. But as his anointing teaches you about all things, it is true and is not a lie. Just as it has taught you, you reside in him.

28.text: And now, little children, remain in him, so that when he appears we may have confidence and not shrink away from him in shame when he comes back.

29.text: If you know that he is righteous, you also know that everyone who practices righteousness has been fathered by him.

1.text: (See what sort of love the Father has given to us: that we should be called God’s children – and indeed we are! For this reason the world does not know us: because it did not know him.

2.text: Dear friends, we are God’s children now, and what we will be has not yet been revealed. We know that whenever it is revealed we will be like him, because we will see him just as he is.

3.text: And everyone who has this hope focused on him purifies himself, just as Jesus is pure).

4.text: Everyone who practices sin also practices lawlessness; indeed, sin is lawlessness.

5.text: And you know that Jesus was revealed to take away sins, and in him there is no sin.

6.text: Everyone who resides in him does not sin; everyone who sins has neither seen him nor known him.

7.text: Little children, let no one deceive you: The one who practices righteousness is righteous, just as Jesus is righteous.

8.text: The one who practices sin is of the devil, because the devil has been sinning from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was revealed: to destroy the works of the devil.

9.text: Everyone who has been fathered by God does not practice sin, because God’s seed resides in him, and thus he is not able to sin, because he has been fathered by God.

10.text: By this the children of God and the children of the devil are revealed: Everyone who does not practice righteousness – the one who does not love his fellow Christian – is not of God.

11.text: For this is the gospel message that you have heard from the beginning: that we should love one another,

12.text: not like Cain who was of the evil one and brutally murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because his deeds were evil, but his brother’s were righteous.

13.text: Therefore do not be surprised, brothers and sisters, if the world hates you.

14.text: We know that we have crossed over from death to life because we love our fellow Christians. The one who does not love remains in death.

15.text: Everyone who hates his fellow Christian is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life residing in him.

16.text: We have come to know love by this: that Jesus laid down his life for us; thus we ought to lay down our lives for our fellow Christians.

17.text: But whoever has the world’s possessions and sees his fellow Christian in need and shuts off his compassion against him, how can the love of God reside in such a person?

18.text: Little children, let us not love with word or with tongue but in deed and truth.

19.text: And by this we will know that we are of the truth and will convince our conscience in his presence,

20.text: that if our conscience condemns us, that God is greater than our conscience and knows all things.

21.text: Dear friends, if our conscience does not condemn us, we have confidence in the presence of God,

22.text: and whatever we ask we receive from him, because we keep his commandments and do the things that are pleasing to him.

23.text: Now this is his commandment: that we believe in the name of his Son Jesus Christ and love one another, just as he gave us the commandment.

24.text: And the person who keeps his commandments resides in God, and God in him. Now by this we know that God resides in us: by the Spirit he has given us.

1.text: Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ has been fathered by God, and everyone who loves the father loves the child fathered by him.

2.text: By this we know that we love the children of God: whenever we love God and obey his commandments.

3.text: For this is the love of God: that we keep his commandments. And his commandments do not weigh us down,

4.text: because everyone who has been fathered by God conquers the world. Testimony About the Son This is the conquering power that has conquered the world: our faith.

5.text: Now who is the person who has conquered the world except the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?

6.text: Jesus Christ is the one who came by water and blood – not by the water only, but by the water and the blood. And the Spirit is the one who testifies, because the Spirit is the truth.

7.text: For there are three that testify,

8.text: the Spirit and the water and the blood, and these three are in agreement.

9.text: If we accept the testimony of men, the testimony of God is greater, because this is the testimony of God that he has testified concerning his Son.

10.text: (The one who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself; the one who does not believe God has made him a liar, because he has not believed in the testimony that God has testified concerning his Son.)

11.text: And this is the testimony: God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

12.text: The one who has the Son has this eternal life; the one who does not have the Son of God does not have this eternal life.

13.text: I have written these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God so that you may know that you have eternal life.

14.text: And this is the confidence that we have before him: that whenever we ask anything according to his will, he hears us.

15.text: And if we know that he hears us in regard to whatever we ask, then we know that we have the requests that we have asked from him.

16.text: If anyone sees his fellow Christian committing a sin not resulting in death, he should ask, and God will grant life to the person who commits a sin not resulting in death. There is a sin resulting in death. I do not say that he should ask about that.

17.text: All unrighteousness is sin, but there is sin not resulting in death.

18.text: We know that everyone fathered by God does not sin, but God protects the one he has fathered, and the evil one cannot touch him.

19.text: We know that we are from God, and the whole world lies in the power of the evil one.

20.text: And we know that the Son of God has come and has given us insight to know him who is true, and we are in him who is true, in his Son Jesus Christ. This one is the true God and eternal life.

21.text: Little children, guard yourselves from idols.

1.text: Therefore we must be wary that, while the promise of entering his rest remains open, none of you may seem to have come short of it.

2.text: For we had good news proclaimed to us just as they did. But the message they heard did them no good, since they did not join in with those who heard it in faith.

3.text: For we who have believed enter that rest, as he has said, “As I swore in my anger, ‘They will never enter my rest!’” And yet God’s works were accomplished from the foundation of the world.

4.text: For he has spoken somewhere about the seventh day in this way: “And God rested on the seventh day from all his works,”

5.text: but to repeat the text cited earlier: “They will never enter my rest!”

6.text: Therefore it remains for some to enter it, yet those to whom it was previously proclaimed did not enter because of disobedience.

7.text: So God again ordains a certain day, “Today,” speaking through David after so long a time, as in the words quoted before, “O, that today you would listen as he speaks! Do not harden your hearts.”

8.text: For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not have spoken afterward about another day.

9.text: Consequently a Sabbath rest remains for the people of God.

10.text: For the one who enters God’s rest has also rested from his works, just as God did from his own works.

11.text: Thus we must make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one may fall by following the same pattern of disobedience.

12.text: For the word of God is living and active and sharper than any double-edged sword, piercing even to the point of dividing soul from spirit, and joints from marrow; it is able to judge the desires and thoughts of the heart.

13.text: And no creature is hidden from God, but everything is naked and exposed to the eyes of him to whom we must render an account.

14.text: Therefore since we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast to our confession.

15.text: For we do not have a high priest incapable of sympathizing with our weaknesses, but one who has been tempted in every way just as we are, yet without sin.

16.text: Therefore let us confidently approach the throne of grace to receive mercy and find grace whenever we need help.

1.text: For the law possesses a shadow of the good things to come but not the reality itself, and is therefore completely unable, by the same sacrifices offered continually, year after year, to perfect those who come to worship.

2.text: For otherwise would they not have ceased to be offered, since the worshipers would have been purified once for all and so have no further consciousness of sin?

3.text: But in those sacrifices there is a reminder of sins year after year.

4.text: For the blood of bulls and goats cannot take away sins.

5.text: So when he came into the world, he said, “Sacrifice and offering you did not desire, but a body you prepared for me.

6.text: “Whole burnt offerings and sin-offerings you took no delight in.

7.text: “Then I said, ‘Here I am: I have come – it is written of me in the scroll of the book – to do your will, O God*.’”

8.text: When he says above, “Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sin-offeringsyou did not desire nor did you take delight in them” (which are offered according to the law),

9.text: then he says, “Here I am: I have come to do your will.” He does away with the first to establish the second.
